Indian Economy.title: CAG report on 2013-14 to 2022-23: Fiscal health of states under strain as public debt trebles in 10 years
Indian Economy.summary: “Compared with the total public debt of the states in 2013-14 of Rs 17,57,642 crore, debt in FY 2022-23 has increased by 3.39 times and from 16.66 per cent of GSDP to 22.96 per cent of GSDP,” the report said.

Indian Economy.title: R&I ups India’s credit rating to ‘BBB+’
Indian Economy.summary: Japanese credit rating agency Rating and Investment Information Inc. (R&I) has upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the ‘stable’ outlook for the Indian economy

Startups & Funding.summary: The Vision Fund layoffs is part of years of cutbacks as the unit lost its importance as compared to Masayoshi Son's growing appetite for AI bets.

Banking & Finance.summary: RBI conducts VRR auctions to infuse liquidity, maintain surplus, and ensure transmission of repo rate cuts into lending rates.

Banking & Finance.summary: In a meeting this week with State government officials, the RBI advised States to spread their borrowing across the yield curve, sources aware of the discussions said

Banking & Finance.title: IRDAI releases FAQs on inter-operable regulatory sandbox to boost fintech innovation
Banking & Finance.summary: IoRS provides a common platform for testing hybrid financial products and services that fall under the regulatory ambit of multiple financial sector regulators, including RBI, SEBI, IRDAI, PFRDA, and IFSCA.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI to back sticking with headline inflation target ahead of review, sources say
Banking & Finance.summary: RBI expected to maintain 4% inflation target with 2-6% band, favoring headline inflation over core, reducing food weightage.

Banking & Finance.title: PhonePe gets final RBI nod to operate as online payment aggregator
Banking & Finance.summary: PhonePe secures final RBI authorisation to function as an online payment aggregator, enabling it to expand services to SMEs and boost digital inclusion.

Technology Sector.title: Indians at World Athletics Championships 2025: Gulveer Singh misses 5000m final spot; Annu Rani disappoints
Technology Sector.summary: Gulveer Singh and Annu Rani had a poor penultimate day for the Indian athletes at the World Athletics Championships 2025 as they failed to move beyond the qualification stage in men's 5000m and women's javelin throw respectively.
